Biology_54_r.News Finding: Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter.
Biology_54_r.Paper Finding: Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer.
Biology_54_r.News Context: Their work also offers evidence that many tropical bird species descended from migratory ancestors that lost migration. Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter. Shifts in range from North America to tropical areas were the dominant pathway for geographical change, and evolved much more frequently than shifts northward from tropical areas.
Biology_54_r.Paper Context: These results illuminate how the evolution of seasonal migration has contributed to greater niche conservatism among tropical members of this diverse avian radiation. Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer. Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America.
Biology_54_r.text: ['Finding: Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter.']
Biology_54_r.displayed_text: Finding: Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter.

Biology_tweet_58_r.News Finding: A paper @username looks at APC's tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture  #OA
Biology_tweet_58_r.Paper Finding: Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling.
Biology_tweet_58_r.News Context: A paper @username looks at APC's tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture  #OA
Biology_tweet_58_r.Paper Context: This observation suggests that the effects of mutations are modulated by a dynamic competition between tumor promoting and suppressive forces that may depend on the signaling status of individual cells and their local microenvironment. Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling. Subversion of these interactions permits mutant cells to persist in the crypt and initiate CRC.
Biology_tweet_58_r.text: ['Finding: A paper @username looks at APC\'s tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture #OA']
Biology_tweet_58_r.displayed_text: Finding: A paper @username looks at APC's tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture #OA

Biology_194_r.News Finding: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics.
Biology_194_r.Paper Finding: Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America.
Biology_194_r.News Context: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics. Eventually, they found that more evidence supported the idea that birds once lived year-round in North America and eventually began migrating further and further south, resulting in today's migrations. This also suggests that many tropical species of birds are descendants of migratory ancestors that lost migration and stayed in the tropics.
Biology_194_r.Paper Context: Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer. Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America. We found that seasonal migration between breeding ranges in North America and winter ranges in the Neotropics evolved primarily via shifts of winter ranges toward the tropics from ancestral ranges in North America.
Biology_194_r.text: ['Finding: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics.']
Biology_194_r.displayed_text: Finding: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics.

Biology_tweet_228_r.News Finding: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so:
Biology_tweet_228_r.Paper Finding: Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass.
Biology_tweet_228_r.News Context: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so:
Biology_tweet_228_r.Paper Context: SIRT1 LKO mice appeared to have increased adiposity with more visible fat, possibly due to increased adipocyte cell size. Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass. Daily food intake was similar between WT and SIRT1 LKO mice on a regular chow diet.
Biology_tweet_228_r.text: ['Finding: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so: ']

Biology_236_r.News Finding: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.
Biology_236_r.Paper Finding: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice.
Biology_236_r.News Context: A clue to this mystery came when Titze and his collaborators noticed an unusually high amount of sodium in the infected skin of mice that had been bitten by cage mates. They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation. Moving forward, the researchers will examine how salt accumulates in the skin and triggers immune responses, and why salt accumulates in the skin of aging adults.
Biology_236_r.Paper Context: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice. Activation of macrophages in the presence of high NaCl concentrations modified epigenetic markers and enhanced p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase (p38/MAPK)-dependent nuclear factor of activated T cells 5 (NFAT5) activation. This high-salt response resulted in elevated type-2 nitric oxide synthase (Nos2)-dependent NO production and improved Leishmania major control.
Biology_236_r.text: ['Finding: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.']
Biology_236_r.displayed_text: Finding: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.

Biology_236_p.Paper Finding: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice.

Biology_tweet_30_r.News Finding: Factor XIIIA-Expressing Inflammatory Monocytes Promote Lung Squamous Cancer through Fibrin Cross-Linking @username @username @username
Biology_tweet_30_r.Paper Finding: Notably, we show that IMs highly express Factor XIIIA, which promotes fibrin cross-linking to create a scaffold for LUSC cell invasion and metastases.
Biology_tweet_30_r.News Context: Factor XIIIA-Expressing Inflammatory Monocytes Promote Lung Squamous Cancer through Fibrin Cross-Linking @username @username @username
Biology_tweet_30_r.Paper Context: Pharmacologic inhibition of IM recruitment had substantial anti-metastatic effects. Notably, we show that IMs highly express Factor XIIIA, which promotes fibrin cross-linking to create a scaffold for LUSC cell invasion and metastases. Consistently, human LUSC samples containing extensive crosslinked fibrin in the microenvironment correlated with poor survival.
